Topic.Title: When those who know you best...

Message.Msg: Freedumber, Perhaps I was a bit harsh. Your point seems right but it is not clear that the vote by people in Massachettes for Obama's re-election was necessarily a vote "against" Romney as it was affirming their common values. While Mass did vote for Republicans as gov from 1991 to 2007, Romney chose to not run for a second term as gov. The people of Mass then voted in a Democrat after Romney. So, as Democrats, do they vote for Obama, who is of their party and philosophy, or do they vote for Romney, who they may have liked - or disliked, as you implied? Not knowing what the people of Mass actually thought of Romney, you implied, I would say without any basis, that Romney was "disliked" by the people of Mass, saying, "He got crushed in the most severe way by the very people he "served" Nothing anyone can say is worse than that, it speaks volumes". From your statements, I drew the conclusion that you were speaking in a disparaging way. I said so. The word "disparage" means: 1. To speak of in a slighting or disrespectful way; belittle. 2. To reduce in esteem or rank. You didn't think so, though your statements otherwise show that really to be the case. Thus, the use of "rationalization": "(psychiatry) a defense mechanism by which your true motivation is concealed by explaining your actions and feelings in a way that is not threatening". We'll ignore the final statements directed towards me and consider them as part of your "defense mechanism". BB

Message.Title: Why Romney Lost
Message.Msg: It was more Romney lost than Obama won. With high unemployment a massive deficit Romney should have won. Here's why I think Romney lost. Mistake 1. He picked Paul Ryan, who couldn't carry his own state. This turned Romney's perception from a moderate Republican to a conservative Republican. Paul Ryan calls for vouchers for medicare and investing social security monies. 2. The public were scared that Romney view on changing social security and medicare would weaken benefits for seniors. 3. With high unemployment the public has become more dependent on government. What if Romney could not deliver on jobs, the public would still need government, and Romney wants to reduce government. 4. Romney did not visit the stricken states from Hurricane Sandy, Obama did. It made Romney appear indifferent to the plight of the ordinary person who will now need more government and FEMA to recover. 4. People perceived Romney as looking out more for the rich than middle class and not caring at all for those struggling. 5. Obama was able to make Romney into a villian by accusing him of calling to end the American auto industry. Romney was never able to explain himself that he wanted the bankruptcy courts to balance the auto makers books in cutting debt. 6. Obama made Romney look foolish in the 3rd debate. Obama lectured Romney that the military does not win wars with horses, bayanets and battleships, while Romney wanted additional submarines and aircraft carriers, but Romney failed to make himself clear.

Topic.Title: When those who know you best...

Message.Msg: For some reason the "reply" button is unavailable on your last post. Bob, your long winded post was nothing more than trying to explain away a clear sign. When you lose your home state, where you were Governor, by 24 percentage points you didn't "lose", you got crushed on an epic scale, and they sent a clear message: "We know you, and we don't want you" (and probably "we don't trust you") The GOP lost the General election because of their Orwellian tactics and attitude. You can';t fix something if you can't see it. You, and your choir, have chosen to live in an alternate reality. Nate Silver bashing (even though he has a track record and was right again, he actually low balled it!) is the clearest example of the anti-reality practiced by the GOP this time around. I would like a strong, non absurd GOP. It would be good for the country, but the current crop is off the rails and it will only get worse (like it did for the Democrats pre-Clinton) if they don't see reality.

Topic.Title: When those who know you best...

Message.Msg: Freedumber, Well, as I said, I was harsh. "Long winded?" I appreciate your thoughts on having an alternative to the Dems, "I would like a strong, non absurd GOP." But, here is the problem: The Dems have driven themselves and their agenda so far to the left that the GOP moving more to the center would only make them look like "traditional" liberals. That may not work for them. What is it that you think the GOP "has become" that they were not already back in the Reagan era? The Dems have embraced unrestricted abortions and begrudgingly put in a perfunctory acknowledgement of God in their 2012 platform. I suspect that God didn't really appreciate being "added" to that sinful platform anyway. Should the Reps now embrace widespread abortions to be more acceptable? The Reps want lower taxes and the Dems want higher taxes. So what else is new? The Reps want to get rid of Obamacare and so do the majority of the people. The Reps believe in a strong military; the Dems are OK with it withering away. The Dems are happy to treat Israel with indifference (as well as hate) and instead embrace the fictional "Arab Spring" and the Reps consistently have taken the opposite path - to fully support Israel. Have you heard that Obama is about to agree with the Russians to allow Assad to stay in power in Syria? True, a rumor, but the news reports are pointing in this direction: "Hopes of dislodging Assad quickly died months ago ..." (L.A. Times, 6 Nov 2012). Here is a guy that murdered more than 30,000 of his people. He can stay, but Qadaffi had to go - who had killed about 300? Obama - remember his "hourly" speeches before he gave the go-ahead to attack Libya - was worried about a massacre in Benghazi - a hotbed of radical Islamic jihadists. "We knew that if we waited one more day, Benghazi — a city nearly the size of Charlotte (N.C.) — could suffer a massacre that would have reverberated across the region and stained the conscience of the world." The end result of Obama's participation in the Arab Spring was to lower Israel's security and the protection of radicals. By the way, the message board limits "replies" down only to a certain level. BB

Message.Title: How the Republican Party can possibly survive
Message.Msg: Get rid of the failed radical tea potty trickle down message started by Reagan. If voters voted for their own best interests the tea potty would only get 1% of the vote! The Republican Party must help the middle class! Republicans must reject right to work for less and instead encourage Labor Unions! Go back to the tax rates the middle class prospered with under Eisenhower! "Should any political party attempt to abolish social security, unemployment insurance, and eliminate labor laws and farm programs, you would not hear of that party again in our political history. There is a tiny splinter group, of course, that believes that you can do these things. Among them are a few Texas oil millionaires, and an occasional politician or businessman from other areas. Their number is negligible and they are stupid." President Dwight D. Eisenhower, l952-----

Topic.Title: BA heading back to low $60's, maybe high $50's

Message.Msg: We need to be thinking long term NOW and preparing NOW! That very, very large Far Eastern nation (that politicians don't want to say directly to get them mad) is going to be many times worse than what we thought Nazi Germany was. They are rapidly and very smartly developing their capabilities (I am talking EVERYTHING in their supply chain for defense -- R&D all the way through massive defense manufacturing capabilities). You are NOT being told this by our government like we should because of our very large fiscal dependencies to them (we owe big time). They are developing 4-5 times more engineers at least there than here and where do you think most of them are being employed? Their manufacturing and supply chain and command/control skills and capabilities are developing and innovating MUCH more rapidly than here for supporting this kind of infrastructure. It is going to happen and we are going to be caught WAY off guard. We ALMOST lost Europe and other critical areas in WWII (please get educated on what happened back then -- it was very scary how close) by being caught naive and off guard. WE ARE NOT GOING TO HAVE TIME (even with our allies finally waking up) TO "RISE TO THE CHALLENGE" TO WIN THIS ONE THE PATH WE ARE TAKING!!!! It is very, very scary and many are going to wake up over time and see that we are defeated and sullen nation and wonder why.

Topic.Title: One Day 1 of his second term Obama said

Message.Msg: C'mon, Doc, The people standing in the lines are perfectly capable of and entitled to mail in an absentee ballot today. What problem has to be solved here? If they don't like the lines, use what is availble. Miami-Dade county had 1042 polling stations open yesterday. The long lines that you saw there were those related to voting early at the 20 available polling stations. We have gone from everyone voting on the same day to voting for a month. On-line is not safe, so forget that. Mail in the ballot, that eliminates the waiting in line and Obama doesn't have to invent anything on "day one". In all my years of voting, I have only waited maybe ten minutes. And I have, save for one year, voted in at the polling station. BB

Message.Title: The Romney "Landslide" That Wasn't
Message.Msg: The Romney Landslide nicely captured the flight of fancy -the collective allergic reaction to reality-- that has defined the conservative media since the day Obama was inaugurated. Faced with the prospect of a second term by a president they had endlessly condemned as an enemy of the state (and much, much worse), the right-wing media embraced pure campaign denial and announced that Doomsday awaited Obama on November 6: • Dick Morris: "Prediction: Romney 325, Obama 213" • Glenn Beck: "321-217 victory for Romney in the electoral college." • Rush Limbaugh: "Everything -- Except the Polls -- Points to a Romney Landslide" • Michael Barone: "Romney Beats Obama, Handily" • George Will: Romney 321, Obama 217 • Newsmax: "Expect a Mitt Romney Landslide" • Larry Kudlow: "I am now predicting a 330 vote electoral landslide." It didn't work out that way.

Topic.Title: Bernanke was not lying Obama has NO policies to support a Recovery

For the first time im my life I'm in a real quandry as to which path to take. Stocks? Real estate? Precious metals? Possibly roulette and/or craps which have poor odds but better than what Obama is offering.

Topic.Title: CNBC Boeing laying off 30% of it managers
